are you logged in as root or using sudo apt-get?
make sure synaptic is closed (or anything of the sort). then if sudo apt-get update still gives you an error, do "sudo rm /var/lib/apt/lists/lock"
scratch that last one, just reboot instead
reboot and apt will be good as new
oh fine, just do the "sudo rm /var/lib/apt/lists/lock"
that'll remove the lock for apt. for example, if you end a process and it had a lock, the lock will stay unless you remove it or reboot
